frame_descriptions: A tight, low-angle close-up on the legs and rear wheel of the second cyclist. The cyclist is on the far left of the frame, and the first cyclist is no longer visible.
A medium shot of two cyclists riding on a paved road. They are positioned on the right side of the frame, suggesting they are just entering the scene.
A medium shot of the two cyclists, who have now moved further to the left in the frame compared to other shots. The second cyclist is directly behind the first.
A medium shot of the two cyclists, now positioned in the center of the frame. They are continuing their movement from right to left.
A closer shot focusing on the second cyclist. The first cyclist is almost completely out of the frame on the far left, with only their rear wheel visible.
reasoning: The correct temporal order is determined by tracking the cyclists' movement from right to left across the frame. In frame_1, the cyclists are on the right side of the frame, indicating the start of the action. In frame_3, they have moved to the center of the frame. In frame_2, they have progressed further to the left. Frame_4 shows a shift in perspective, getting closer to the second cyclist as the first one is almost out of the frame. Finally, frame_0 is the last in the sequence, showing a tight close-up of the second cyclist just before they exit the frame completely. This sequence (1, 3, 2, 4, 0) represents a smooth and continuous motion.
